intro: Strobilanthes pulcherrima, commonly known as the "Beautiful Flame" or "Coral Beauty," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a flame. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
